intro: Tithymalus esula, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Tithymalus esula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a range of soil types.
